io.artframework

Interface Configurable<TConfig>

  • Type Parameters:
    TConfig - the type of the config that should be loaded

    public interface Configurable<TConfig>
    Marks the ArtObject or Module as configurable.

    The art-framework will try to load the given config at runtime instantiating a new object from the class. The config class must be public and have a parameterless constructor.

    The load(Object) method of this class will be called everytime the config is loaded or reloaded. Make sure you implement your loading logic accordingly and reset any caches you might have.

    You can also annotate your class, load method or config parameter in the load method with the @Config annotation. This will allow it to load the config directly from a file based of the base path of the art-framework.

    If you do not annotate it and the configurable class is a ArtModule, the identifier of the module will be used.

    See Also:
    Config

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void load(TConfig config)
      Loads the given config.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        void load(@NonNull
          TConfig config)
        Loads the given config.

        The method will also be called anytime the config is reloaded.

        Parameters:
        config - the config that is loaded
